creditline: The Alan and Dena Naylor Southeast Asian Art Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: shallow bowl with lid with scalloped, upturned rim and domed shape; cream glaze with traces of underglaze iron designs
markings: incised lines (Potter\'S marks), on underside of lid and bowl
text: While influenced by Chinese models, Vietnamese potters made their own innovations and added new elements to their designs. The domed lid of this bowl, for instance, has a scalloped rim that probably imitates the edge of a lotus leaf. The spontaneously brushed underglaze floral decor is executed with an iron rich compound. This type of covered bowl was popular during the 13th and 14th centuries.
title: Bowl with Lid
